name: Grants for Veteran Services (GVS)
description: Awards reimbursement grants to eligible charitable organizations, local government agencies, and Veterans Service Organizations that provide direct services to Texas Veterans and their families.

name: Fund for Veterans' Assistance (FVA)
description: The foundational funding mechanism providing over $359 million in grants since 2009 to support Veteran services. Revenue derives from Texas Lottery veterans tickets and voluntary donations during license/registration processes.

name: Texas Veterans + Family Alliance Grant Program
description: Grant program supporting Texas Veterans and their family members through charitable organizations and service providers.

name: Claims & Disability Compensation
description: Assistance with Veterans' claims and disability compensation services.

name: Hazlewood Education Program
description: Education benefits and scholarship assistance for eligible Texas Veterans.

name: Employment Services
description: Job placement, career development, and employment support services for Texas Veterans.

name: Mental Health Support Services
description: Comprehensive mental health support including peer network, suicide prevention, homeless Veteran services, and justice-involved Veteran support.

name: Women Veterans Program
description: Specialized services and support resources designed for female Veterans in Texas.

name: Health Care Advocacy
description: Advocacy and support services to help Veterans navigate and access health care benefits and services.

name: Veteran Entrepreneur Program
description: Business development and entrepreneurship support services for Veterans starting or expanding businesses in Texas.

name: TVC Grant Grantees Directory
description: Directory of all organizations and agencies currently receiving grants from the Texas Veterans Commission to serve Veterans.
